title: Can't connect to server after championselect
body:
Hello guys! 
I have a very terrible issue: 
Since some days i cant connect to the loading screen after i locked in a champion in champion select after the countdown is over. My screen gets black and after around 10 seconds a message pops up which says "can't connect to server. Please check your network connection...". The funny thing is that i can connect to the loadingscreen on NA server, Japanese Server and Oceania Server, but not on EUW, EUNE and Turkey! 
I've already tried to reinstall League of Legends (5x) and i flushed my internet connection. I literally tried everything (even resetting my PC)!
I hope some of you are able to help me, because this issue is so terrible and is basically preventing me from playing League of Legends{{item:3070}} 

kind regards,
WinniPoo

replies.body:
Since you're only seeing this issue on certain Regions, your connection is probably running into issues along your network routing to those specific sets of servers. Before we look at your network route, I'd recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your local settings are 100% compatible with Leauge.

Please let me know if this resolved the issue.

Hello Targons Blade,
First of all: Thanks for replying!
After I checked every point in your connection guide I tried connecting to a game (custom game) and I unfortunately were still not able to connect.
I wonder if other players on EUW Server have such a problem as I currently have.

Since those steps were unable to resolve this, the issue is most likely in your network routing, as I mentioned previously. I recommend running a traceroute log with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) so we can determine where the issue is happening exactly. After loading up WinMTR, plug **185.40.65.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 min has gone by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you encounter issues with those steps.

That's exactly what I needed, thanks!

Your route looks normal, however, your traceroute reveals that you're using a **Hitron** branded modem. This brand has known to run firmware that can cause issues connecting to League. I recommend reaching out to your ISP and request they push a firmware update to your modem so we can make sure you're running the most updated firmware that is least likely to conflict with League.

If you encounter further issues after updating that firmware, let me know.

Hello Targons Blade,
Sorry for not replying to you for like a month.
It might sound a bit weird, but today I tried to play a game of League of Legends and everything actually worked and I could play the game again.
Thank you for taking time for me and my issue to help me! :)

kind regards,
WinniPoo
